website_summaries.verdict: For light- to medium-duty jobs, this breaker bar can loosen lug nuts and smaller, rusted-on bolts with ease. For heavier jobs, however, it may not always be suitable.
pros: Provides leverage to loosen stubborn lug nuts and bolts
Swivel head stays securely in place with very little play
cons: Length can be difficult to work with in tight spaces, such as when working on brakes or changing oil
Swivel joint may fail during high-torque applications

customer_reviews.title: Broke the first time I used it.
customer_reviews.text: The square drive sheared off the first time I used it.
customer_reviews.author: Sonyslave

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful tool and great value
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived in beautiful shape. The swivel at the end is just the right tightness. The handle section is actually a little larger around than the main shaft and that makes it fit well in my hand. It's heavy - but that's expected and desired. Can't find anything to complain about and have not used it above 80 ft-lbs yet - so can't answer the question on everyone's mind (what is its max rating). But it will be nice to have for when its needed ! I've included a photo with it alongside a few other related tools so you can get a feel for its size (and think about what else you might want to get ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Optimist

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Was changing a flat tire like I've done a few times but ran into a lug nut that would not break loose. That's when I found out about a "breaker bar". Most work done in changing a tire is breaking loose the lug nuts. Now I don't have to strain my hand from all the force using a short lug wrench on a stubborn lug nut. I also bought the Titan Tools 21092 19mm 1/2" Drive Non-Marring Deep Lug Nut Socket so shouldn't disfigure the socket whenever I ever have to apply lots of force. If your are not sure what size socket to buy just go to the autozone website, enter your car then search for "lug nut".
customer_reviews.author: Jose Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Broke the first time I used it. It was like throwing money out the window
customer_reviews.text: Broke the first time I used it! It broke off where the socket connects.Very disappointed. Not sure if it was just defective or if it is just a junk wrench
customer_reviews.author: Anthony A.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality at a Good Price
customer_reviews.text: I've had to use the 24" breaker bar on numerous projects, and never once have I felt like it was anywhere near its breaking point. The feedback through the shaft is excellent (you can 100% feel the "tick" when you finally get a bolt to break loose), it's not unbearably heavy, and the rotating head joint doesn't feel like it's going to come loose any time soon. I've used various equivalents from Snap-On, MAC, and other "professional" brands, and this feels just as solid as they do. Save the money and pick this one up!
customer_reviews.author: ccrenshaw2012

customer_reviews.title: Use on your foreign super car lugbolts to save your back. Right?
customer_reviews.text: Keep one of these in my Mercedes to bust the lugbolts loose of need be. This thing is a massive BIATCH and can break that lugbolt loose and then I just jack it up and twirl it off. (Also, keep a 140 ft-lb 1/2 inch torque wrench in there too, with of course, the right size speed socket (usually a 17mm for a late model Mercedes.) The real story is I paid too much for that steaming pile of german road rocket and I want no one else touching those stupidly expensive tires or lugbolts but me (ps #IHATETHATCARBUTAMSTUCKWITHIT).
customer_reviews.author: DanPurserMD

customer_reviews.title: Works fine - but why they ship with a plastic cap is beyond me
customer_reviews.text: I don't get why they're shipping these with a plastic top stuck on (anti theft?) - does the seller expect people to resell this? The last thing I really want when I get a tool is look around for some pliers just to use the thing. Not that it's a huge hassle, but still it's a little beyond me.. That aside, works about as one would expect, haven't had any problems with using it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: High Quality "Live Steel" .. feel the "Tinks" .. 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in anticipation of changing out the carrier rollers on my dozer and it met all my expectations. Actually, it broke free a couple of 10-1.5mm bolts that the 1/2" impact wrench was struggling with. Breaker bars are generally pretty brutal tools, but you can actually feel what's going on with this one .. the little "Tinks" telegraph down to your hand on the very well designed and finished handgrip. The "Tinks" are important, as you may judge whether to proceed, or squirt on some more PB Blaster and give it another day. After all, it's called a breaker bar .. it will break it loose, or break it off :) Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: attaboy

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a amazing and has become an invaluable member of my tool ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a amazing and has become an invaluable member of my tool chest. I even keep it in the trunk with a 22mm socket, to replace the tire iron I used to use. with 2 feet of lever to work with, even the most rusted-on bolt is turned into smooth butter by this monster. I never even bother to use any penetrating catalyst any more. The swivel head can be annoying sometines as you have hold it when first put the bolt in the socket. But once its on there, the swivel gives you the flexibility thats key to using this big monster in some unusually locations around the wheel well.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Stillwell

customer_reviews.title: Good 1/2” drive breaker bar
customer_reviews.text: I was using this to take off an axle nut and it didn’t break or anything. I like how the head is the impact and not just chrome. The good thing is unlike a regular socket without a swivel head attachment you can turn at any angle. I was able to sit on the breaker bar to loosen my axle nut. I had to try a few times but it did the trick. Toyota Sienna axle nut is 30 mm FYI.
customer_reviews.author: Jimamazon

customer_reviews.title: Extra! Extra! Read all about it! Best Extension Breaker Bar Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so that headline was cheesy, but this breaker bar is not. It may not be much, but that sucker didn't break when I used a leverage bar to remove a blade that just would not come off the stubborn mower. The one it replaced broke. So there you have it, a quality item. I hope you enjoyed the headline, I sure enjoyed writing it and using this product. 8P
customer_reviews.author: CajunDragon

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Great quality. Con: none. Worked exactly as advertised. Its a simple tool, but very handy. Used to remove and tighten some bolts on my Jeep. Would think about getting the 3/8" breaker instead of this one, just due to the sockets I own. I do have an adapter though, from 1/2" to 3/8", so its all good. Be aware of the length of this however: 24 inches is extremely long for many tasks. 18" long 3/8" breaker might be enough for many jobs. Just depends upon what and where your job is. Wouldn't hesitate to buy again. Seems to be great quality, though it is a very simple tool.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Rating sale... not product
customer_reviews.text: The transaction went smooth and I received what I ordered on-time and as described. So that is what my 5 star reflects. The breaker bar looks like it might be a quality piece, but it has not been tested, and I bought it only for a single use; failure is not anticipated. That is the reason it wouldn't be fair (nor wise) to rate something not yet tested. It very well turn out to be a 5 star value, and have both 5 star "durability" and "sturdiness"ratings.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Works as a multi tool!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this breaker bar works great for that. I have had to remove some stubborn nuts, and had about 600 pounds worth of adult (me and two buddies) hanging off the end of this thing. It did bend a little (any piece of metal would) but it sprang right back to normal shape once we let off. The nut did finally pop off, and this gem was still intact. I've also used it to pry on items when necessary, and to bend a piece of sheetmetal once, so now I think it qualifies as a multi purpose tool. lol
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy It Is
customer_reviews.text: Need leverage, this is one to purchase. So far, it is holding up and fills its designed purpose. At the time of purchase, the price was right (the lesser cost) over others. Oh, the finish is holding up as well, appearing to be a natural steel finish, unlike many of others that have chrome plating for their polished appearance.
customer_reviews.author: G'Wood

customer_reviews.title: This breaker bar gives you the torque required to get ...
customer_reviews.text: This breaker bar gives you the torque required to get those stubborn fasteners loose. The head has a bit of wobble however and could have been tighter, hence the 4 star rating rather than the 5 it could have been. It makes the tool feel a bit less robust, although it has performed well for me in use as a professional mechanic.
customer_reviews.author: G****

customer_reviews.title: Works great for getting of lug nuts
customer_reviews.text: I really like this breaker bar. I got it specifically to take off lug nuts in case I get a flat tire. I'm an older guy and need the extra leverage. My family has four older cars...2003 Grand Caravan, 2001 Lincoln LS, and two 2007 Hyundai Sonatas. Each has a different size lug nut. I also bought sockets to go with this breaker bar. This breaker bar allowed me to pretty easily get the lug nuts off. The people who put my tires on use the impact wrenches and always seem to really tighten the nuts. This breaker bar is solid and feels professional. I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Tough Tool
customer_reviews.text: Great breaker bar. Used to remove 150 ft/lb. nuts that are 17 years old and untouched and seized. Used with OEMTOOLS 22397 17 mm Metric Socket. Removed nuts with ease. Great quality and length provides all the leverage needed. Not a bit of a struggle to remove nuts. First used standard 1/2 in. drive 10 in. long ratchet and nuts did not budge using all my strength. Im certain even someone with no muscle tone could remove most stubborn its and bolts with this breaker bar.
customer_reviews.author: Mesa man

customer_reviews.title: Working hard since 2016
customer_reviews.text: I've had this breaker bar for about four years now and it's got me out of a lot of sticky situations. I've sheared off a few bolts now and it's still going strong. An impact wrench has superseded it in some applications now, but this puppy will still break off anything when other tools won't.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tool to replace water heater anode
customer_reviews.text: I read many reviews and decided to go with this 24" breaker bar. Glad that I did! I didn't need to use and extension for more leverage because of limited space. The anode was 5 years old and wouldn't budge. I braced the water heater to the 3 side walls so that it wouldn't twist when I removed the anode. I had previously shot some WD-40 into the hole where the anode was and after several hours, gave it the old heave ho! After several attempts, the anode finally broke free and the rest was easy. Great quality, value and best of all, it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Took a beating
customer_reviews.text: Took a beating and survived no problems. I can see this lasting a long time, probably my entire life.
customer_reviews.author: ohGr

customer_reviews.title: As good as I expected. Real easy to extend.
customer_reviews.text: Needed something to get stubborn bolts loose. Guy that had the Jeep before me used his impact wrench on everything. Even the oil pan drain plug! One of the "Experts" that has a breaker bar "Testing" video griped the handle needs to be fatter. Looks just the right size to just slip in a 2' length of steel pipe and not rattle around to me. Instant cheater extension.
customer_reviews.author: Robert O. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Excellent breaker bar
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality tool that feels good in the hand, and works well. I keep it under the seat of my truck for emergencies/repairs. I also have a 24" breaker bar in the house (just in case), but this 18" is what actually gets used the most. Plenty of length for most jobs.
customer_reviews.author: J. VDE

customer_reviews.title: an unequaled tire changing experience can be yours with this device ! don't hesitate to buy it
customer_reviews.text: this product revolutionized my experience of changing tires at the roadside. The typical tire changing wrench included by the original automobile manufacturer is not adequate for the task. This makes quick and immediate work to relieve that lug nut that just will not come off. Combined with the techtron 1/2 inch multi inch drive sockets, this is an unbeatable combination and should be essential for any automobile owner. the leverage afforded by this wrench makes the most difficult to remove not no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Monahan

customer_reviews.title: It works if you have plenty of room.
customer_reviews.text: Indispensable tool for working on cars and getting those stubborn bolts off. Due to the design, it has a lot of play, so I'll probably replace it with one where the handle goes around the head.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Maraver

customer_reviews.title: Indispensable around the Garage
customer_reviews.text: Bought two for a recent timing belt change and couldn't have done it without them both. Sometimes an impact wrench just won't cut it. OD of the handle is ~7/8" so keep that in mind if you buy a pipe to use as an extension bar with it.
customer_reviews.author: Andy in TN

customer_reviews.title: You Need One
customer_reviews.text: For years I have made due with being innovative when breaking bolts loose. I have a 3/8" breaker bar and when it really needs it, I will throw a pipe on the 1/2" ratchet. Having a 1/2" breaker bar has been a much needed advantage to breaking anything loose. I honestly wish I had invested in one years ago. The quality of this particular bar seems to be just fine. I have pulled at least 300-400 lbs on it and it barely flexes. I would think that this bar can handle the majority of an average mechanics needs. Obviously, use the right tool for the job, don't use this when you know you should be using 3/4" drive.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Goldfield

customer_reviews.title: Broke pretty quickly
customer_reviews.text: I got 2 or 3 uses out of it before I sheared the square drive off. I never put a pipe on it, never jumped on it. It's a a shame, it seemed really nice, and it is a super handy tool to have. But I supposed there is a reason you pay twice as much for similar tools from reputable companies. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Came In Handy Many Times
customer_reviews.text: There are some bolts out there that refuse to move. But some penetrating oil and this breaker bar can really fix that problem real quick. This thing is very solidly built and it has come in handy many times when I've needed a stubborn bolt removed. With great power comes great responsibility though. Make sure you use the right size socket and have firm contact before applying muscle as you can strip a bolt pretty easily with this much torque.
customer_reviews.author: G. Martin

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty looking, it should work just fine. It was worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: It looks solid, I haven't used it yet. I purchased it just in case I or someone gets a flat tire along the road, it should do the job. It's a nice looking tool, it was worth the money. I also purchased a 40 inch long pipe at Home Depot that will fit over this breaker bar too, just in case I or someone needs that extra leverage. I don't want to get stuck along the road due to not having the leverage to remove any nut.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did what I wanted it to do
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with lug nut sockets in remote places where an impact wrench is not available. I used it immediately after it arrived to break loose and unscrew some lug nuts on a hay trailer. The nuts were very tight and we had previously failed to loosen them with a regular 4-way lug wrench and also a battery powered impact wrench. It was no problem. I attached the proper 13/16 lug nut socket and put my weight on the breaker bar and off they came.
customer_reviews.author: Hastings

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. ....Not to mention there are no instructions for getting the lock off of it
customer_reviews.author: Swaydaa

customer_reviews.title: Solid, durable, affordable
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly solid Breaker Bar, just what you need to get the job done, using this to take the bolts off the bed of my 2002 Ford Ranger to replace the fuel pump. Did brakes first, used for lug nuts and each bolt was a breeze! The only thing I will mention that I didn't care for was the ridiculously huge box it came in, could have saved some cardboard there. Lol
customer_reviews.author: matthew veggian

customer_reviews.title: Works great, as described
customer_reviews.text: This breaker bar is great. I was worried it wasn't long enough as I couldn't find one longer. But it is the right length for nasty work. Any longer would be hard to use. This is a lot longer than your regular breaker bar. I like the design too. It didn't budge when tackling the really nasty bolts (no torquing of the head). This was a great addition to the garage.
customer_reviews.author: M. Acker

customer_reviews.title: Very well made.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to remove some bolts that were frozen. I put a LOT of torque (pressure) on this breaker bar and it did not break. It "bent" just a little bit. But, it quickly went back to it's original shape. It is very strong and it will give you a lot of power when removing or installing bolts, nuts, or whatever. This was a good investment for my tool collection. I'm quite sure that this breaker bar will last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: 3rdGen

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the OEM lamp in my rainwater purification system. It has been installed for 90 days now, and seems to be doing the job. It is almost identical to the OEM light, and installs easily and in the same manner. Now to see if it lasts the entire year without failing. Great price!
customer_reviews.author: Circle B Ranch

customer_reviews.title: All the breaker bar most weekend mechanics would ever need.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice tool. Sturdy and well made. Excellent polished finish. Use it to break loose stubborn lug nuts and other tough bolts and it’s performed like a champ. No flexing or twisting. Good breaker bar for the price. Not a tool you have to spend extra money on, this one is just fine.
customer_reviews.author: GAB1500

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and durable but the adapter Male end feels cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Works well however the tightness and pain that is put through the socket Male end seems to be cheap and could break. I'm still using it often and so far no problems. Torque specs I've loosened with this have been up to 110 ft lbs. I think the limit is closer to 200 ft lbs on this.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Harbert

customer_reviews.title: Nice for sure!!
customer_reviews.text: Only time will tell how long this will last but it definitely seems very sturdy for sure. Made of cr-v steel so that’s a plus so we will see but seems great. Definitely 2 foot long which been loving that part definitely make breaking bolts and nuts loose a lot easier for sure.
customer_reviews.author: danny's 03 bugeye

customer_reviews.title: Breaker Bar
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a great tool is all I can say right now. Can't comment on durability because I haven't used it yet. i bought as an insurance tool for my vehicle in case I have a flat somewhere. The tool for removing the wheel nuts that comes with modern cars does not provide enough leverage to remove the nuts. This breaker bar will provide the leverage needed.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Maestas

customer_reviews.title: Beefy breaker bar.
customer_reviews.text: Two foot breaker bar. If you do any mechanical work, you'll need one of these sooner or later, probably sooner. This one looks good, not a lot to say as it's basically just a steel bar with a swiveling head, which is nice for clearing obstacles and spinning off nuts. I'll post back if I ever manage to bend or break it, but that seems unlikely, and would probably take a ten foot cheater bar on the end, which I probably won't put there...
customer_reviews.author: isiton?

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to keep in the trunk if I needed to replace a tire. Also it was very useful when I replaced the belt pullies as I needed to relieve the tension and the engine bay is crowded and I couldn't get my hands down to reach the belt tensioner, but this breaker bar did a one hour job in less than one minute. The length/torque is excellent as you can break-loose anything with ease, just use a torque wrench when you re-tighten something.
customer_reviews.author: Solo wing

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my SUV lugnuts
customer_reviews.text: I had a flat tire recently on my SUV and the stupid 12" lug wrench supplied with the car would not break the lug nuts loose because the dealer horsed them down far beyond the 103 foot pounds of torque called for by the manufacturer. This breaker bar with a 17MM deep impact socket is the ideal set up for removing even the most stubborn lug nuts. I don't think this is a daily use shop mechanic quality tool but for my situation it's ideal.
customer_reviews.author: RolidnotTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: great tool to keep on hande
customer_reviews.text: I've been driving for over 30 years and just had my first flat on the road. I had this tool in my truck and it made changing my tire extremely easy. I bought a second one to keep in my other car just in case. seems solidly built. made removing the lug nuts almost effortlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Tony O

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I knew it was 2' long when I ordered it but I was still surprised when I open the box. It like a baseball bat almost providing great leverage, it was hilarious how easy I loosened my lug nuts. Great quality, super heavy, surface finish is highly polished. I wish they would have knurled the handle a bit but now I'm knit picking, for the money can't beat what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Miami Dude

customer_reviews.title: BROKE RIGHT AWAY
customer_reviews.text: I used the tool for all of 10 minutes before the head snapped clean off. I would have returned for a refund but it was past a month of purchasing it before I needed to use it. Oh well...
customer_reviews.author: MINNESOTA

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool, did the job and should do so for a long time
customer_reviews.text: Hey all, had to break some brake caliper bolts on my SAAB 9-3 which most on youtube said were very difficult to break without a very serious breaker bar. Chose this one, and can happily report that its very solid and worked like a charm on my brakes (E20 torx socket, 1/2" drive). I reckon you'll be happy with this one!
customer_reviews.author: jonnyb

customer_reviews.title: Haha, i had a 8 inch breaker bar...
customer_reviews.text: My 8 inch breaker bar worked enough for a looong time. I would put a pipe on it to give me the extra leverage. buut, was not able to handle strut bolts. This giant behemoth of heavy steel turns anything with ease. the bolts screamed open.
customer_reviews.author: Brian/Claire

customer_reviews.title: Great breaker bar. Well made.
customer_reviews.text: I like to work on my car and fix stuff in my house. I am not very strong so having extra leverage is always helpful. I use to use this a lot, but lately, I prefer my Milwaukee impact wrenches for stubborn bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Ogi

customer_reviews.title: all meat - no filler!
customer_reviews.text: The breaker bar does its job! I ordered this after cursing out the the factory supplied "crow bar" when I had to change a tire on my car. This bar's length provides the mechincal advantage to break any lug nut, no matter how tight it was cranked down. I loosened all the lug nuts and tightened them back up to spec using a torque wrench. Keeping this bar and the lug socket in the car with the spare tire.
customer_reviews.author: a drinker with a music problem

customer_reviews.title: High Quality - Should Work on Just About Anything
customer_reviews.text: This 24" breaker bar with a 1/2" drive should take care of just about any bolt or nut that needs to be loosened. It's great for lug nuts that may have rusted onto the wheel studs. The breaker bar is heavily chrome-plated, so it should resist rust and serve for several decades, at least!
customer_reviews.author: The Veteran

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this breaker bar to remove the lug nuts from my Toyota Sequoia and felt safe using this tool to put them back on with the added torque. Was feeling bold and tried using it to remove the rusted axle nut from a Karmann Ghia and ended up snapping it--so recommend only use for lug nuts.
customer_reviews.author: J. Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: This thing is decently heavy duty and I like the swivel. The extended handle really helps break off those stubborn seized bolts/nuts without attaching a pipe or something similar. It helped me remove my CV nut to get to my ball joints and it is affordable so I’m pretty satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: CDizzie

customer_reviews.title: Love this breaker!
customer_reviews.text: This made my job easy. I had a suspension replacement DIY job I was working on with a 2004 Jaguar and had a few bolts that had been in place since 2004. This saved me some significant strain and I love having it iny tool kit. I recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Randolph

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for lug nuts!
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of bad reviews about people putting way too much torque on this tool working on axels or whatever, breaking it and then being pissed about it. All i can say to that is, theres nothing like trying to get a job done with the wrong tool! Duh... the 24" breaker bar i bought from amazon warehouse USED for $18 has been workn out jus fine! ive been using it on lug nuts without any problems. I think its a good tool, especially for $18.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Keep it in my trunk at all times
customer_reviews.text: This breaker bar (1/2 socket) is exactly as expected. It takes lug nuts off with minimal effort. I keep it with me at all times and use it to loosen the lugs before swapping summer/winter tires on all my cars twice a year. It has a good grip, sturdy, and has never let me down. I hope it lasts for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Carl F. Shannon

customer_reviews.title: I am impressed.
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money. I replaced the corroded wheels on my Toyota Tacoma. Post replacement the wheel lugs were a different size. I bought Neiko breaker bar and socket for the new lug nuts. The bar works great. I am impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Upnorthdoug

customer_reviews.title: A must have.
customer_reviews.text: Everybody should have one of these. Makes busting bolts free too easy. I purchased this specifically for a stubborn caliper bolt. The little bastage didn't stand a chance ... now I use it for tires and, well, I'm pretty much looking for any reason to use it .. turns me into the Hulk.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Don't ask, just get it, you'll need it.
customer_reviews.text: Decided to do my own brake job, this breaker bar and the torque wrench are what made it possible! Ended up saving more than $300 from what the mechanic shop quoted, and they wouldn't have given me the tools. 😁
customer_reviews.author: Bob from Accounting

customer_reviews.title: Makes taking wheels off much easier.
customer_reviews.text: What a difference compared to the L wrench that came with my car. This bar removes wheel nuts like a champ. The one time I used the L wrench that came with my car, I had to stand on it to break the nuts free. Always keep it in my car, tucks into my trunk without being in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Andico

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be well made and no problems yet.
customer_reviews.text: It's a break bar. I've had it for a couple months with no issues. Beat on it and no problems, but i'm not a professional mechanic, so not getting daily use. Does the job well, ended up being a bit big for some situations so i got a 16" from neiko as well, 3/8 drive on that. This 24" cracks lucks quite easily.. using breaker bars really makes me miss air tools though. Had it a lot longer, still works, no issues. solid breaker.
customer_reviews.author: EN Wags

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this after leaving my 15" on top of car and getting on freeway, you know the sound and feeling when it drops. I went with 18" this time, I use it for my lug nuts and it provided a little more length for better torque. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert Villanueva

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS WORTH
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and works as described. Nice build quality and serves its purpose really well. I have already used this on numerous occasions to install new wheels for my own cars and my friends. Not as heavy as other breaker bars I’ve used in the past but definitely has a nice weight given it’s thin handle. Can stress this enough, but the build quality is superb!
customer_reviews.author: Talktomegoose

customer_reviews.title: Tighten up
customer_reviews.text: This breaker bar looks more robust than I expected. Based in the length of 24", I think it needs to be more robust than a 12" or 18" wrench to pull the torque on the socket. I haven't used this bar yet, but am impressed with the looks of it.
customer_reviews.author: K Wicker

customer_reviews.title: It’s a Weapon
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t order this as a mechanical use I ordered as a weapon because I hate people that tailgate me so when that does happen I pull this break bar out the window and smash tailgaters windows and just take off so they don’t catch me so far it has worked still here and not under arrest
customer_reviews.author: Aisha

customer_reviews.title: This came to the rescue!
customer_reviews.text: It is a breaker bar, very durable and reliable. Able to go in tight spaces where an impact can't reach and able to produce the torque necessary to remove fasteners due to it's long length. Leverage is your friend, the finish is nice and smooth and shiny. You can't go wrong buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Emac

customer_reviews.title: This Tool Saved My Azz, Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Talk about the right tool for the job this is it. I had my John Deere tractor serviced with new blades. They must have put them on with an air impact gun. When it came time to change them the bolts were locked solid. I tried for over an hour using various methods and a spray lubricant. It was frozen solid. Using the Neiko the bolt met it's match, I had it off in two minutes. This is a serious well made tool worth the money. Not something that you frequently use but there is no substitute when you really need it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L.

customer_reviews.title: Great for lugnuts!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for removing/installing lugnuts on my van. Works great, hardly any force is needed with this setup!! Would HIGHLY recommend to keep in your vehicle (beats ANY OEM lug wrench!!). Thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had one years ago
customer_reviews.text: Now I can get the lugnuts off after I get work done at the shop around the corner. I swear they love torquing to 150 lbs. They say they use torque sticks and maybe they do but not the ones for my tires. Quality is ok not perfect but the price was right and I don't plan to make a living using it. Great for shadetree guys like me.
customer_reviews.author: David E.

customer_reviews.title: High quality, solid & well built!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the Neiko 1/2 Inch Drive Breaker Bar much so I can't comment on long term durability but it seems to be high quality, solid & well built. I've used this on high torqued bolts and performed as expected.
customer_reviews.author: THX1138

customer_reviews.title: Its a real 1/2 in breaker bar
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for money mine has already been tested and passed! Good size well built heavier than proto in fact but likely much lower grade steel. My only gripe is the swivel on mine has play and the screw holding it may be metric and hard to adjust. This in no way during use caused a problem i just lime them tighter.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Jeffords

customer_reviews.title: A hefty breaker bar.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to remove blade bolts on my zero turn 50" mower. Long enough to really get some leverage on the bolts, making removing/replacing the blades an easy task. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bill J

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: Product works as advertise. It’s nice and sturdy. You can feel the quality of the tool. Rotating my tires was quicker than previous times. Would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: OJ

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I have been able to crack several bolts when a torque wrench couldn't. It's amazing what you can get off when using the the proper tool and leverage.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Thin enough handle to slip an extension pipe over it and strong enough to break 160 ft. pounds of lug nuts without missing a beat. Good bearing holds sockets in place. Does what I need it too.
customer_reviews.author: GT

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughters car after watching her struggle with the stock lug nut tool in her car. It will really give her a huge mechanical advantage if she ever has to change another tire. They are inexpensive enough that I have one in every vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Big W

customer_reviews.title: Very solid and higher quality than expected
customer_reviews.text: I used this breaker bar HARD as soon as it came. It held up great. The little socket retention ball stayed in its hole, the bar didn't bend. the pivot stayed tight, and the chrome stayed on. It's better than many other cheap breaker bars.
customer_reviews.author: W. Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: When you need a breaker bar, nothing else will do. Strong and does the job. Only prob is having ample space to work with but I have other, shorter ones.
customer_reviews.author: PhilY

customer_reviews.title: Great value, for a moderate duty bar
customer_reviews.text: For the price . . . I don't think you'll find a better bar. The length allows for good leverage but it is not a heavy duty industrial grade bar. In removing 3/4" nuts, I was getting considerable flex which was pushing it's capabilities. The head design also is not heavy duty. I'm glad I didn't break the breaker bar.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bow

customer_reviews.title: Beefy and Does the Trick
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after trying unsuccessfully to remove lug nuts on a flat tire using the cute little and almost useless wrench that came with a Lexus. This will do the trick now every time.
customer_reviews.author: Gery Sasko

customer_reviews.title: **DANGER**
customer_reviews.text: While the product works exactly the way it is intended, the paint or coating used on this breaker bar actually cut my hand when I went to use it. It comes off in thin layers, while I can appreciate the aesthetic of having it be a shiny silver like most tools, users should take care when grabbing it.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah Cesal

customer_reviews.title: This is a BEAST.
customer_reviews.text: This has worked great and for $20. Like a hot knife through butter. Easily took lug nuts off my Jeep. Had tires put by the local Air Tool Zombies this broke the lugs free so I could tighten with my torx wrench.
customer_reviews.author: grcubfan

customer_reviews.title: Must have tool in your car/truck for tire change
customer_reviews.text: Exceptional good quality, and the extra leverage that I need, so that I don’t hurt my back! I also ordered the ARES 70056 flip socket set. The flip lug nut socket set includes the 6 most common wheel lug nut sizes. You’ll be ready to help anyone on the road!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry, IndySteppers

customer_reviews.title: Quality product, priced right and works flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product is well made and a bit bigger than I thought, but that is a welcome difference. This breaker bar works flawlessly and provides a great amount of leverage in getting nuts loose. Overall quality is very good and in line with expectations of higher dollar products. I would definitely recommend this tool for the budget conscious looking for a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: EricTop Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this product since I'm not familiar with the brand. But at the end of the day, its a breaker bar..it's solid and it did the trick breaking loose some over torqued lug nuts. I highly recommend this for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Alko

customer_reviews.title: Worked as it stated it would. Did its job.
customer_reviews.text: Helped remove my corolla axle nut. Helped remove engine bolts in the Jeep Grand Cherokee. No problems. Did its job. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Redbear1

customer_reviews.title: Great price. I was skeptical at first give the ...
customer_reviews.text: Great price. I was skeptical at first give the price of the tool and initial inspection of how the head attaches to the handle. I didn't think it'd last or be able to handle much torque. During a recent project, I used it to bust loose rusted wheel nuts on drive axles that were originally torqued down to 175+ ft./lbs. Impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Lee B.

customer_reviews.title: Extra length is Handy
customer_reviews.text: I like this breaker bar because of the little longer length than average. Overall build is good but I have yet to use a simple tool like this that wasn't well made.
customer_reviews.author: Blackford

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should had one
customer_reviews.text: Being around cars most of my life I have seen my fair share of crappy jacks & breaker bars. I hate ones that are 14in. That doesn't give you enough room or torque. This thing is 24inch. The grip is good. I would put a rubber handle for better grip.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: I use this to loosing drain pan plugs and break lug nuts loose. Works as expected and makes the job so much easier with the increased torque and leverage. Awesome tool for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Nomad

customer_reviews.title: Leverage through two feet length.
customer_reviews.text: This tool provided the leverage I needed to get into a tough spot and remove an oxygen sensor that I could not budge with a much smaller breaker bar. That plus using an extension bar to get to the O2 Sensor bit in a very tight spot and under a jack stand. You get that, it worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Blain Lane

customer_reviews.title: Great Breaker bar, especially for the money
customer_reviews.text: Just used it this past weekend. And let me tell you I loved it. Worked so well I thought it was just stripping the lugs at first. I wish I had bought it a week early and would have saved my body some hassle. We'll see how long it holds up and last, but I have other neiko products and so far they are all doing well.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended to remove tough torqued bolts.
customer_reviews.text: Well using this awesome breaker bar I removed the lug nuts from my Volvo to change out the snow tires. Used a Sears torque wrench because it was cheaper and on sale at the time. Also, purchased a 6 point hex socket and changed out the snows in record time to my summer tires. The tire guy charged me $60 and was done in 10 minutes. It took me about 45 minutes, equipment will pay for itself next season. I was going to buy Kawasaki impact wrench to loosen my 100 ft pound torqued bolts but this did the job perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Castiel

customer_reviews.title: Good but sometimes scary
customer_reviews.text: It works well, though it does flex when dealing with heavy bolts so I sometimes worry that it will break violently. But it hasn't broken yet. Though I have broken a 1/2 to 3/8 adapter on this.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Denekamp

customer_reviews.title: very high quality
customer_reviews.text: just used it (along with a 1/2" to 3/8" adapter) when changing my idler pulley in my 2005 trailblazer lt ext great quality, but it's a little strange that the socket is actually rotated 45 degrees instead of being square on the head. it was a little difficult getting it in the tensioner pulley to release the tension from the serpentine belt with the amount of room and the angle i had to use with all the other stuff in the way. if the socket was square with the head, it would have given me more leverage.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Very well constructed bar. Very sturdy and was a life saver for removing those tight lugnut that were on our truck. I highly recommend this bar. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: JanetP

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: I lost an 18" one I liked and so then got this 24" since more is better, right? Turns out 18" was enough but 24" was too much so returned the 24" and got the 18" A fine tool but overkill for automobile lug nuts use. Compare the weights and your tool storage space.
customer_reviews.author: Matt P

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Use it on lug nuts, caliper bolts, and the sort. Probably only used up to 150 ftlbs but hasn't show any signs of breaking any time soon. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: jwoesahv

customer_reviews.title: Short Return Window
customer_reviews.text: I tried to return this ... but there is a very short return time. I missed it by 10 days ... what a company :(
customer_reviews.author: Bville Boy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect as a lug nut wrench with plenty of leverage.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this breaker bar combined with a deep socket and short extension as a lug nut wrench. I needed this because my new wheels have very deep access holes to get at the lug nuts. I'm impressed by the quality of this big tool and it's long length which will give me plenty of leverage.
customer_reviews.author: RICKVOO

product_meta.title: Neiko 00206A 1/2 Inch Drive Premium Breaker Bar, 24" Length | Cr-V Steel | Chrome Moly Head
product_meta.description:
Size:24''Heavy-duty power for really stubborn nuts and bolts. Extra long handle- (24 inches) length provides incredible leverage at anvil; contoured grip for sure grip. Anvil head rotates 180-degrees for increased versatility. Break bar made with heat-treated Chrome-Vanadium steel construction for long-life durability. Mirror-chrome finish is corrosion resistant. An essential tool for every professional and serious do-it-yourselfer - a real life-saver with impossibly-tight fasteners.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Heavy-Duty 25" Breaker Bar - 1/2"-Drive - Chrome-Vanadium Steel
feature_bullets: 24 Inch extra long chrome vanadium steel handle provides maximum torque
Forged and heat treated chrome-moly 1/2” drive head for added strength and durability
180-degree flexible head works at any angle, to reach around tight space and generate optimized leverage
Spring-load ball bearing holds sockets securely
Ideal to break and loosen rusted, stubborn or stuck nuts and bolts
Meets or Exceeds ANSI standards ASME B107.110-2012
